p: The main risk factor for mortality due to COVID-19 is advanced age. In patients with comorbidities, such as chronic kidney disease, hypertension, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, diabetes, tumor, and obesity, advanced age was the strongest predictor of a poor outcome with infection ( 33, 35, 37). Male sex has also been proposed as a risk factor in some studies ( 1), but this is not an universal finding ( 38).
